alert.note: Alert for East Washington Central Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 18 at 5:39AM PDT until August 18 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HOT DRY AND UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON... .Today will be the hottest day of the week with triple digits common for elevations below 3000 feet. The heat combined with low humidity and an unstable atmosphere will promote high fire danger especially during the hottest time of the day. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR UNSTABLE THERMAL TROUGH FOR THE EAST WASHINGTON CENTRAL CASCADES... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 696 East Washington Central Cascades (Zone 696). * Winds: Generally terrain driven and less than 8 mph. * Timing: Through this evening. * Relative Humidities: 10 to 20 percent in the valleys and 20 to 30 percent over the higher terrain. * Temperatures: 100 to 105 in the valleys. 15 to 20 degrees above average for the mountains. * Impacts: Increased potential for rapid fire growth for large fires due to unstable conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of low relative humidity, hot conditions, and an unstable atmosphere can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
